body_html: @danmane My problem was that the graph was not yet defined, sorry. Perhaps it would be worthwhile to note in the error message in TensorBoard that the graph passed to SummaryWriter needs to be fully defined. What I expected was that one could simply pass sess.graph before building the graph and it would be written with the next add_summary. Or, perhaps, completely remove the writing operation from the constructor, because such side effects in a constructor are somehow counter-intuitive (but that's perhaps just me).

body: @danmane My problem was that the graph was not yet defined, sorry. Perhaps it would be worthwhile to note in the error message in TensorBoard that the graph passed to SummaryWriter needs to be fully defined. What I expected was that one could simply pass `sess.graph` before building the graph and it would be written with the next `add_summary`. Or, perhaps, completely remove the writing operation from the constructor, because such side effects in a constructor are somehow counter-intuitive (but that's perhaps just me).
